conclusion: Apply principles of electromagnetism and circuit analysis to solve the problem.
Identify components: square wire frame with side length L, uniform magnetic field directed into the page, capacitance C, current I to be found, induced EMF E to be calculated.
Use the formula for induced EMF: E = BLv.
Relate velocity v of wire frame to magnetic field strength B and side length L: v = BL/R.
Magnetic field weakens uniformly at rate k, velocity v decreases at rate dv/dt = -k.
Substitute v = BL/R into EMF formula: E = BL * BL/R * 1/sqrt(1 + (dv/dt)^2).
Velocity decreases to BL/R at end of time t, final velocity v = BL/R.
Substitute v = BL/R into EMF formula: E = BL * BL/R * 1/sqrt(1 + (BL/R)^2).
Side length L is equal to radius R of loop, thus R = L.
Substitute R = L into EMF expression: E = B^2 L^2/L = B^2 L.
